Xayah is probably the best person for Rakan, as far as we know nobody else fights for the Vastaya and nobody else cares about their problems. And hypocritical ideologies are far from the worst traits in the League of Legends roster.

I mean tbh Hypocritical ideologies are amongst some of the most fucked up shit. 

I mean if you outright go and murder someone with a legitimate reason, I mightn't agree, but I will understand it.
If you're hypocritical about it, what's the point in that view in the first place?

That's true, but I was more referring to being hypocritical in a general sense, rather than the ideology itself. There have been plenty of movements wherein the people involved want positive change for themselves due to a lacking disposition, but are indifferent or opposed to other, specific groups getting something similar.

Basically Xayah has a cause to fight for and sees most other things as less important, even herself. The only thing she's shown to care about is the freedom of Ionian Vastayas and Rakan.

Yeah, pretty much. Hypocrisy is basically everywhere and it's hard to say with a straight face that anybody exists that isn't a hypocrite in some form. Yet, despite this, good things still come from seemingly hypocritical thoughts and actions. It seems irrational to say it, but good things have come from those we would label hypocrites. I wouldn't call hypocritical ideologies necessarily an evil, because often they're borne of necessity because something straight-laced generally doesn't get enough appeal to make any meaningful changes, whereas sacrificing something that would make it seem hypocritical could allow at least _something_ to get through that can actually help people.

And yeah, Xayah is a great fit for Rakan. She seems like the kind of freedom fighter who, when asked about liberation of other peoples, doesn't really concern herself with them because she's focused on one thing at a time.
